Carlton Pearson’s Career and Success

Carlton Pearson’s career is a testament to his unwavering faith, his willingness to challenge conventional religious dogma, and his commitment to spreading a message of love and inclusivity. From his humble beginnings as a Pentecostal preacher to his emergence as a prominent figure in the world of spiritual thought, Pearson’s journey has been marked by both controversy and acclaim.

He gained recognition for his fiery sermons and charismatic leadership, establishing a significant following in Tulsa, Oklahoma. He founded the “Higher Dimensions Church” in 1982, which quickly grew in popularity.

  • Theological Shift and the New Breed Church (1990s):In the 1990s, Pearson underwent a profound theological shift, questioning traditional interpretations of hell and divine judgment. This shift led to his establishment of the “New Breed Church” in 1996, where he preached a message of universal reconciliation, a belief that all humanity will ultimately be saved.

He has authored several books, appeared on numerous television programs, and delivered lectures and workshops worldwide. His teachings have inspired many to embrace a more inclusive and compassionate approach to faith.

Pearson’s ministry and the New Breed Church have had a significant impact on the religious landscape, particularly within Pentecostalism. His emphasis on universal reconciliation has challenged traditional interpretations of salvation and sparked a dialogue about the nature of God’s love.

The New Breed Church has become a haven for those seeking a more inclusive and compassionate faith, attracting individuals from diverse backgrounds and denominations.
